'Manaus' ( or ) is a city in Brazil, the capital of the state of
Amazonas. It is situated at the confluence of the Negro and SolimÃµes rivers. It
is the most populous city of Amazonas, according to the statistics of Brazilian
Institute of Geography and Statistics, and is a popular ecotourist destination.
Manaus belongs to mesoregion Center Amazonense and microregion Manaus. It is
located in northern Brazil, from the federal capital, BrasÃ­lia.

The city was founded in 1669 as the Fort of SÃ£o JosÃ© do Rio Negro. [http://www.buzzle.com/articles/major-cities-of-
brazil.html Foundation of Manaus] It was elevated to a town in 1832 with
the name of "Manaus", which means "mother of the gods" in tribute to the
indigenous nation of ManaÃ³s, and legally transformed into a city on October 24
of 1848 with the name of Cidade da Barra do Rio Negro, Portuguese for "The City
of the Margins of Black River". Only on September 4 of 1856 did it revert to its
current name. [http://www.ywamcity.org/city.asp?id=86 About Manaus]

It was known at the beginning of the century, as Heart of the Amazon and City of
the Forest. [http://www.wsava2009.com.br/eng/hotel_travel/tour.php Heart of
The Amazon and City of the Forest] Currently its main economic engine is
the Industrial Pool of Manaus.

It is the largest metropolitan area in Northern Brazil and the eleventh in all
of Brazil, with 2,283,906 inhabitants (IBGE/2012). The population in 2012 was
1.85 million people; it is the most populous city in North Region and seventh
most populous city of Brazil, according to data from Brazilian Institute of
Geography and Statistics, the IBGE. The city gradually increased its
participation in the GDP of Brazil in recent decades, rising to account for 1.4%
of the economy of the country in 2010, with all that economic power coming
mainly from the Free Economic Zone located in the city. Currently, the city is
one of 12 most influential cities of the country. Manaus alone represents 10.89%
of the population of the whole of Northern Brazil and 49.9% of the population of
the Amazon. [http://dbpedia.org/page/Manaus Facts of the city of
Manaus]

The city will be one of the host cities of the 2014 FIFA World Cup, for which
Brazil is the host nation. [http://fifa2014wiki.com/fifa-2014-host-cities-and-
venues/69/ FIFA 2014 Host Cities and Venues]
categories: Populated places on the Rio Negro (Amazon)
